conclusion: Determine the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched.
Power can be derived from the work done by the Lorentz force on the projectile.
Lorentz force on the projectile is given by F = B I d.
Work done by the Lorentz force to launch the projectile is W = F * L.
Calculate work done by Lorentz force: W = 0.1 J.
Work done is equal to the change in kinetic energy of the projectile.
Kinetic energy K is given by K = 1/2 m v^2.
Solve for velocity v: v = 3.16 m/s.
Time t can be found using v = L/t.
Solve for time t: t = 0.158 s.
Power is defined as the work done per unit time.
Power is also the product of the voltage and the current.
Voltage V can be found using the formula V = B I d.
Calculate power using voltage and current: P = 2 W.
The correct power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is 2 W.
